sub_title: Experienced Project Manager, Researcher and Expert in children's rights, child- and youth participation, international development, humanitarian aid, social sciences, sustainability and tourism
summary:
I have a background and extensive knowledge in children’s rights, child- and youth participation, human rights, international development, humanitarian aid, sustainability, social sciences and tourism. Over the past years, I developed a skillset and hands-on experience in project management, knowledge management, research, proposal development, business development, quality assessments, M&E and drafting of reports for the public (Dutch Ministry of Foreign Affairs), private (Ecorys) and non-profit sector (UNICEF). 

Do you need - or know someone who needs - some extra pair of hands/set of brains? Please, reach out and I am looking forward to further connect with you.

volunteer_experiences.description: Weekly Dutch conversations with a Syrian migrant to improve his language skills

GeoHealthAccess – The Geography of Vulnerability and Health Service Access in Southern Africa 
This study developed a model to be used to identify the most important barriers to access to health services in poor resource contexts in Southern Africa. The tool combined perceived access to health services with measured, geographical access, and individual characteristics:
•	Performed multiple ArcGIS analyses to prepare for the qualitative data collection for the GeoHealthAccess project; 
•	Qualitative data collection and analysis: 20 interviews and 4 focus groups with female headed households and health care workers in Malawi.
